reviews.review_msg: goes through basically all questions on exam and wants you to succeed, his material is well explained in lectures and full of examples! Very helpful in office hours and would often stay late

Warren's part of the course saved my grade. I almost failed the first midterm but aced the final due to his practice examples in class. Go to lecture because he literally says whats on the final. Professor Warren is a very enthusiastic and I genuinely enjoyed his lectures. Take a course with him hes great.

THE GOAT. Explains, shows examples, re-explains. It is so easy to do well with Warren. Just show up to lecture and tutorial and he will tell you what is in the test. Albeit, the material is not easy stuff, but you will do well by paying good attention and watching the practice videos he posts on Canvas. Thank you for changing my life GOAT
Explains concepts really clearly and did lots of example questions. He will make the most out of pocket jokes and it really keeps you engaged in the class!

Just like leznoff, u can tell he likes chemistry. He is very energetic and hilarious. tends to say "what the sigma" and references the diddy party here and there. he only covers 3 chapters so he has tons of time for examples which help u understand things better. Leznoff had to go over 7 in the same span so that's why he seems worse. Overall amazin

Best prof i've had. So fun and made me wanna come to lectures. He'd do examples that would be similar to the final. Cracked jokes making the most complex ideas fun. Loved this guy and would take a class with him again 100 times. GOATED prof.
good prof does examples

took chem 121 with him. after a horrendous first half of chem, warren came in clutch when he was needed most. lectures were enjoyable and he did a lot of examples for the class which really helped for the final exam.
Warren's half of the course literally saved my grade after doing horrible on the midterm. It was so easy to understand concepts and he used a lot of examples as well. Warren the goat!!!!!

Warren is awesome. I SCRAPED by in this class, but Warren's half of the course absolutely saved me. He works through a lot of examples and practice questions, giving you ample opportunity to practice and do well. He's also very accessible, and encouraging. His lectures are fun, and he keeps the good vibes going.

Dr. Warren is such a lovable guy. His lectures are always enjoyable and I really appreciate how he puts effort into making the content actually interesting via his tone and method of teaching. He had lots of cool demos and I really appreciated how he went above and beyond to help his students after how poorly we did on the midterm.
Really entertaining prof. He is really good at teaching and tries his best to engage the class with his gen z humor. He wasn't lying when he said the final was easier.

He's a nice person, but I'm not sure why he's so hyped. Every year these two profs pray on people's downfall by giving really hard and long exams that people can't finish in time. Incredibly difficult exam questions compared to the little material taught in class. He was better than Leznoff, but overall avoid taking chemistry with these two ever.
GOAT Chem duo with Prof. Lenzoff. I really enjoy them in chem. They are funny and their lectures are really helpful for midterm and final exam
GOAT duo along with Prof Lenzoff. Really enjoy them both. They are funny and their lectures are helpful for midterm and final.
Easily best prof ive had so far. Perfect lectures, always engaging. Love u Warren
He is a very good teacher and explains things very well

(part 2 - I am the one who posted the review below). Warren also told me to drink pilk (pepsi + milk) combination before the exam and boy oh boy I for sure listened to him. I was gripping the toilet seat after the final but I did it because he's my pookie.
10x better than Leznoff this guy made me want to wake up and go to class
If you like chemistry and stand up this the prof youre looking for
On my second attempt of Chem 121 with Warren again and he is even funnier (if you like a prof who does alot of examples you will be very happy)

Perfect Prof. PERFECT. He is up to date with how modern day students learn and want to be taught. He does his lectures in two ways - Pictures and words. He also provides sufficient examples which helps you complete assignments flawlessly. The content is quite easy too!
Favorite First-year chemistry prof
jeff is a great teacher and goes through many examples in class. his practice exams are really similar to the actual exams
Dr. Warren is great. The lectures were never boring, he would always do examples of final exam questions during lectures, and always willing to help everyone.

he is the best prof I have ever had. he genuinely cares for your success and wants to see everyone do well. I did so bad during leznoff's section but warren saved me. he did lots of examples in lectures that appeared on the final! he is such a goated man and if it wasn't for him, I would have failed.
His lectures were very useful with lots of examples! He also posts lots of practice problems and shows how to do all of them which was very helpful.

Jeffrey Warren is an absolutely AMAZING chem prof. His lectures were very clear and easy to understand, and he also liked to inadvertently say some pretty amusing things during his explanations. He makes the material easy to understand and also does some example problems during lectures. 10/10

Example heavy lectures. And in comparison to Leznoff, teaches in a slower pace which was a godsend to the first section of the course. His section of content honestly saved me from failing the course.

Warren is an awesome prof!! He's super helpful during office hours and was willing to take the time to go over confusing topics. He did many examples of even basics like Lewis dot structures and stoichiometry. He's super funny and makes lectures worth attending. He is an amazing professor and makes up for the rocky first half of chem 121 w Leznoff.

His lectures were so funny and very easy to follow (especially after the difficulties keeping up with Leznoff's lectures). He obviously cared a lot about chemistry and his students. I hope I can get another class with him again.
Warren goes over lots of examples in class. Make sure to understand each of them and you'll be prepared for the final.
Very engaging, up to date, loves memes, and teaches well.

Dr. Warren is great, he genuinely wants everyone to do well. Lectures were a blast. He does plenty of practice problems that are super relevant, so make sure you write them all down, he also posted additional problems and answers on canvas. It may seem like a lot since there's a lot of content, but thats just how it is

Warren is a great prof that wasn't afraid to crack some jokes and just be a good person. His lectures were engaging, straight to the point, and full of examples and review. Would 100% take a course with him again.
He's great and always willing to help 10/10

Dr. Warren is a pretty good prof in general. His exams are difficult but his lectures are fun which I find interesting. However, to get a really high mark like an A in this class, I guess note-taking/summarizing the chapters and reading the book are what must be done along with doing a lot of practice questions to fully understand the material.

He's such an amazing professor. Seems like he actually cares about his students and not like Leznoff who would expect us to watch lectures outside class time... One time I went to Warren's office hours and he helped me for like 30 minutes with my homework.. such a kind soul. I recommend him to anyone who is not good at chemistry.

This guy is the absolute goat and my favourite prof by a mile. He does so many examples in lecture and straight up gave our class around 15 out of the 50 types of questions we'd see on the final. I ended up barely passing the midterm when Leznoff was the prof, but thanks to this legend I did well on the final and finished with a solid grade.

Dr. Warren is the Top G of SFU. Even though his ability to use his iPad and technology in general was severely limited, his teaching ability was not at all hindered by it. I was getting a 14% average before his half but after he took over, I suddenly understood every single CHEM121 concept and ended up getting an A+ in this course thanks to him

This class was super heavy, but Professor Warren made it a bit more tolerable. Going to lectures was fun as he was always making jokes that I sometimes forgot about how depressing this course really is. Be prepared to study hard, as there are a lot of difficult concepts to go through.

Dr. Warren is great. He provides super engaging lectures that encourage students to learn. And besides the common technological error on his iPad, everything was great and I really recommend taking his class. He provides lots of worked examples which are great to review. Overall great prof, 10/10. #WarrenApproved

Cool guy, pretty sure he stalks the discord servers as hulk hogan. Felt like I understood his section of the course better. Lots of examples in-class/online to help understand concepts. The class is just difficult, final was like practice final, but that still just means it was hard.

Warren is very personable and entertaining. Chem 121 is hard, but he makes going to lectures fun. He gives good examples and explains concepts well. He will help you if you go to office hours. GO TO OFFICE HOURS! Practice is key. This class is humbling to say the least. Praying 4 u, not cuz the prof but the class is brutal

Really nice guy, office hours were hilarious. Short lectures, but explained well. Use the assignments and textbook questions to study, midterm and final are fair with some tricky questions - learning concepts & practice is key if you struggle with chem. Quizzes are worth more than the final so make sure to take them seriously - no feedback given.

I was super nervous to start online classes, especially as a first-year. prof warren is honestly so kind and genuine. he communicates with us on the daily and does an absolutely amazing job using our gen-z lingo. he is chill and extremely helpful as well. the course is difficult but prof warren gives me motivation to want to do well.

Think "American suburban movie dad". This is what he looks and sounds like, yet he is a meme KING. He found ways to make chem so fun and did great experiments. The class was very difficult but he was so accessible and did multiple review sessions before the final for struggling students (like me!). For a tough subject like chem, he's a gem!
One of two profs who split the chem121 lecture during the semester, and Warren was definitely the better half of the semester. Funny and introduced topics in ways that kept the class intrigued.

Prof Warren is HILARIOUS. Go to all of his lectures if you're feeling down. If you didn't get the material, you got a good laugh. And you can always come to his office hours to clarify the materials; he is always available to help if you asked and will readily extend his office hours near the exam day to accommodate all students.

Hands down one of the nicest people I've ever met. Dr. Warren has a clear passion for chemistry but also teaching. If you ever go to office hours (highly recommend you do), you'll see how much he cares about his students. He puts in a great amount of effort into making sure you understand concepts and makes the content a little less intimidating.

Jeff's a funny guy, the content of the class is extremely difficult though but he tries his best to make it interesting/easier to understand; the final was mostly conceptual and was definitely easier than the midterm

Jeff Warren is a knee-slapping hilarious prof. He is highly accessible outside of class and spends extra time in office hours to help out his students. His lectures are fast-paced, so be ready to to spend a lot of time outside of class reviewing.

Tough content but lectures were funny + interesting. He really knows his stuff and he is good at explaining it. Decent amount of loncapa but very doable. Definitely go to tutorial esp if a certain topic is challenging for you
He is a really approachable person in office hours, and knows what he is doing. Jeff is organized and makes lots of jokes. Overall, I enjoyed his class and would definitely recommend him.

Jeff is easily the best prof I've had so far. So funny I literally made a word doc where I wrote funny quotes and ended up with two pages. Including: "So what, nuclear energy is just a deeply unsexy steam engine, yes yes it is" "I dont trust fed ex or UPS I have trust issues"
final was completely theory based. I am not good at chem but studied a lot and ended up with a C+, when I am normally an A student

Lectures have quite a bit of content. Be sure to review it afterwards by reading the textbook. Very engaging and really connects with the students. Always prepared and does a great job. Also, always finish the LONCAPA to succeed!!!!

Awesome prof and hilarious guy! Chem 121 was definitely a hard course especially for a first year. Make sure to attend office hours if you dont understand a concept or ask Ta's . Exams, midterms and some lon capa questions were hard but lectures+office hours+tutorials helped me. Really wish he taught chem 122 because he a good prof.

He is very willing to help during office hours. He stayed an extra hour just to go over my midterm with me (even missed a lunch meeting). He says he's just doing his job but I must say he goes above and beyond. I wish he taught Chem 122 as well since he is an awesome prof. Exams were challenging. Make sure you start studying after midterm is over.

A very funny & knowledgeable prof! The best way I learned was by going to all the tutorials and that was extremely helpful. Study in advance as you can't learn everything a few days before the final. Also read the textbook and do its problems! You need to be able to understand many concepts and be able to apply them to the final exam questions

Very funny and nice guy. Explains well but outside help is needed to do well. Very accessible and makes lectures worth coming too. It's a difficult course tho. Very heavy and you can't fall behind. Definitely makes you work for it. I recommend going to tutorials as I actually got a solid understanding from them which helped during lecture.
Hilarious professor, be prepared for a laugh every lecture. However, he is a hard marker and makes difficult exams.
Great guy, lightens the mood of the class with jokes and is pretty good at explaining complex chemistry concepts. Would take a class with him again.

I've had her for a lab professor, she yelled at me for no reason what-so-ever =.= her instructions confused me..I went to her for help once..and she yelled at me telling me to look for my TAs during their office hours, but the thing is my TA doesn't have office hours..Would it kill her to help me with a quick question?
He was teaching in a cool and fun matter but the exams were so heavy and hard, they were not matching the teaching, as well as the homework's that we did.

Dr. Leznoff is so passionate about chemistry and cares about his students. His music every morning was great! It's so sad people think that he is an bad prof due to the sheer difficulty in the first half of the course. His midterm was difficult yes but I think he did that for good reason. Just keep working hard, do loncapa and go to tutorial.

Very likeable prof, midterm average was 47%, said they wouldn't curve it and definitely didn't;) Leznoff's Topics are difficult especially with lack of examples. DO THE TEXTBOOK QUESTIONS!!!! do not trust that the practice tests are the same as the tests! Loved the daily music and he explains general concepts well but expects you do the homework!

He explains things well, but does NO EXAMPLE problems. Unless you have prior Chem knowledge, the midterm will be a slap in the face for you. The tests aren't even hard, but since he doesn't do practice problems in lecture, people never know how to solve them and avoid making the trap errors that he puts in every question. Lezzy,Pls do more examples
A very caring prof but focused his slides more on interesting chemistry facts rather than chemistry itself. Read and do the textbook q to have a better chance of doing good in the class.

Leznoff really likes chemistry but his slides and lectures are not all that helpful. He doesn't show that many examples and his goes over things really fast. My advice would be to read the textbook and understand the concepts yourself and ask any questions to chatgpt. Also do the assigned textbook questions, they will help with the midterm.

Leznoff was a really energetic and passionate prof. Loved his personality as he was a fun and caring, however his midterm was tough due to the fact that he didnt do many examples. His lectures were interesting (most of the time) but most importantly he really wanted his students to do well and exceed. A quality that most profs dont have.

He made the class harder than it needs to be. His part of the course was more familiar material from highschool, yet his midterm was worse than the final and was SUPER difficult. He says to do the textbook Qs for practice because they resemble midterms Qs, surprise, they dont! Also he does no examples in class and rambles abt history instead

professor leznoff is very passionate about chemistry but sometimes in his lectures he speaks a bit fast so it's hard to grasp the topics. he doesn't do examples so it's better to do practice questions by your self. and the midterm was hard asf

Prof. Leznoff's passion for chemistry and students doing well is apparent. I really enjoyed his lectures and appreciated his encouragement throughout the semester. His midterm however, is brutal. I think the only way you can expect to do well is if you grind out the textbook and spend a lot of extra time, or are naturally good at chemistry.

Dr. Leznoff made lectures really enjoyable and gave off a good vibe every start of the class via the music videos he would play. They were always specific for the lecture topic and I appreciate his effort to give off these good vibes before delving into the days topics. It was clear that he really had an appreciation for the lessons he was teaching

Doesn't wish for his students to succeed at all. Every year they give the same exams that they know majority of the class will fail, and never care to teach by providing examples to change that 47% yearly exam averages. Thinks that by being funny it covers up for trying to purposely fail as many people as possible. Don't ever take a class with him.
He is a good teacher, but doesn't do examples in the lectures which make them harder to understand.

Leznoff is a really awesome person and teacher! However, his exams are nothing like the content in the lectures. It will be the same overarching idea but it will be a different structure, different wording, and different numbers. Cool guy though

Very thoughtful and passionate prof, and a great person. He doesn't do many examples during lectures so read the textbook if you are confused. Do the textbook questions because the midterm is based off of it.
doesnt give example problems in class, non curved 47 percent midterm average

Wasn't a bad prof, very helpful during office hours but don't learn anything from the lectures so u have to to a bunch of independent reading. Very passionate and knowledgeable, enthusiastic during lectures

If you're not into chemistry you won't be interested in the lectures but if you are then they will be very engaging and comprehensive for you. Rarely goes over examples in class but the homework is harder than the exams so if you read the chapters and finish the homework you'll be fine. Very caring prof, he always answers questions in lecture.

Leznoff is awesome, goes above and beyond to give you tools to succeed. Do the practice questions, utilize the resources he posts before exams. Class has some inherently difficult content but he sets you up for success.
he is a pretty good prof but a lot of his exam questions are not stuff we covered in class or briefly went over like once or twice. he is a super caring prof and really helpful during office hours
Great prof very passionate about what he is teaching. Easy to stay engaged during his lectures.
hes a good guy but I wish he did more examples in lectures. he focused a lot on the history of chemistry and wanted us to be very inetersted in that but it didn't help with doing the Lon capa lmao.

He is very passionate about chemistry and his lectures had good information and explanations, but there weren't many examples, sometimes making completing homework hard. Be sure to go to tutorial because they will go through examples!

Daniel Leznoff is an amazing prof. His lectures were easy to understand and the content was presented clearly. At the end of his half of the term (the course was co-taught with Jeffrey Warren) he gave this incredible speech about how in uni, you're in the right place to learn literally anything, so do whatever your heart desires. Absolutely 10/10
He's passionate about chemistry and you can see that in his lectures. However, his lectures can be difficult to understand as he's quicker with teaching the material. Practice problems will save you.

He very clearly loves chemistry and cares a lot about students. (He was especially kind to us when protestors entered our lecture hall and shouted at us.) Lectures were difficult to keep up with as they were very content-heavy, but they were ultimately extremely helpful in fully understanding concepts for the midterm. Just study and you'll be fine

Prof Leznoff has an obvious deep love for chemistry and spreads that to the students he teaches. While his lectures were difficult to keep up with as they were very content-heavy, they ended up being extremely helpful to fully understanding topics. He also was a very big proponent of the arts and encouraged students to be well rounded people.
Leznoff is definitely passionate about what he teaches, but doesn't go over any examples in class, which makes going to tutorials important in order to do well on the midterm.

Leznoff was a good prof, engaging but his tests were so damn hard. The average on the midterm was not even above 50. He doesn't do many examples in class so the homework assignments through Lon Capa take a lot of time. Definitely need to put a lot of effort into studying and preparing for exams. Exams are MC but take a long time.
He was always entertaining
Boring Lectures. Full on nerd. I'm not into it.

Professor Leznoff is definitely passionate about what he teaches but personally for me, from time to time, I wasn't able to keep up with the material and sometimes I thought he went a little bit fast. He also posted videos on some problem he mentioned in class (but not all). His exams being based on both calculations and some theory questions.

I am horrible at chemistry (course isnt too bad if your chem skills are strong!) but I was always keen on going to Leznoff's lectures because he makes you wanna be there!! Made me more interested in chemistry than before. Leznoff fun guy, passionate bout them elements. Discord server chat saved my life, do lon capa the moment you get it.

Great prof. Not a big chemistry fan but he gives interesting lectures and has an obvious passion for the material and desire to engage. Fair amount of homework (usually there's a discord help server, saved me), but just a really nice and respectable guy.

This class sucked so bad. I was asleep half of the time in his lectures. He has very dry lectures, doesn't give examples in class but would rather have you watch in your own time. And the TA wasn't that helpful either. I could barely read what was written on the board; they need some budget for whiteboard markers.

Leznoff is super passionate and always had a good time teaching. The content was dull and pretty boring but I don't blame him for that. He didn't go over many examples in class and his slides were awful and filled with a lot of extra useless information. Luckily his explanations were good and that made surviving the dull parts worth it.

Overall, he was a good prof as he was organized and available for help outside class. Make sure to be following along at all times as he does go over things really quickly and it's easy to fall behind. Unfortunately he doesn't do many examples so if you have the textbook try to do the recommended ones. Tutorials helped so much, don't skip those!

As this is DEF a weeder class, I was weeded out to say the least. BUT, Dr. Leznoff was a cool guy and provided lots of info but his lectures were dry and was NOT engaging. I wish he suggested practice problems (like Warren did for the 2nd part of course) or made the course easier to follow. TA's were nice and he was, but lectures were a doze off.

This guy was very passionate about chemistry and his lectures were very engaging, but it felt like I didn't learn much from the lectures at all because he would never do any examples of the intense calculation problems the lon capa homework had. Textbook was pretty useless for me and I never really used it and still did pretty well. GO TO TUTORIALS
He did a good job engaging the class sometimes but the lecture material was very very difficult to understand and he did not scale a midterm with a %47 average for the class. TA's were good though.

Very passionate professor, you can go to office hours and ask him about anything that interests you about chemistry. He will give a thoughtful response 100% of the time. CHEM 121 is very difficult and feels like he just needs a few more lectures to fully explain the concepts in the detail he wants to. Do textbook questions and take advice he gives!

Dr. Leznoff sparked my love for chemistry. You WILL want to have him as your professor, his lectures are extremely engaging, he is a sweetheart, and you can tell that he really enjoys what he is teaching. He posts lots of help videos as well as experiment videos from past terms. Take his class and you won't regret it. 10/10

He's a nice guy who genuinely wants to help kids learn and I thought I was really absorbing the information as I normally had no issues with the lon capa homework, but the lon capa was WAY easier than the midterm didn't reflect it at all. Feel like the only way to prepare for the midterm would be textbook problems, tutor or ask him for practice

Unwilling to help with homework questions. He is funny and shows he cares; however, he talks extremely fast, and it gets overwhelming quickly. Does not give very many examples and feels like he just expects you to understand the work. He is passionate about his job, but sometimes it feels like he thinks we are a chore.
47% average on midterm, no scaling.

You can tell he is very educated and a well respected prof, however his lectures are very heavy with confusing concepts with no of background info. He gives a confusing lecture and just throws extensive LON CAPA. Not to mention, our midterm average 47% was the lowest in chem SFU history. The practice midterm was nothin like the exam. Disappointing
biggest pet peeve in this class is the equation sheet. at this point, just memorize the equations.

He gets a lot of flak for the difficulty of the course, which is really outside of his control. It's a lot of material to cover in one course!! You can really tell he loves his job and he loves his students and he makes lectures engaging and as fun as possible. Just be prepared to put a LOT of work into this class, no matter who's teaching it.

He's a nice dude and he speaks with a passionate voice during lectures which makes it easier to pay attention. However the lecture material is often complicated and he doesn't do the best job of explaining everything. The midterm was also WAY HARDER than the practice midterm and the class bombed it (47% average).
Danny is super funny and makes lectures interesting, but his midterm was much harder than the practice which was annoying. - Gavester

Pre-lecture readings of concepts and and the textbook is a requirement to succeed. The subject is heavy and difficult and cannot all be covered in lecture time. His recorded lectures, although longer, are extremely helpful as they are more detailed. Homework is more difficult than midterm but there's unlimited resources for homework help.
the worst.
Enthusiastic but lectures are not helpful. don't recommend taking him. bad experience.

Pre-recorded videos typically were around an hour+. Beware, the practice midterm and final are much easier than the actual exam. I recommend actually going through the textbook even a term before taking this course so you don't overwhelm yourself. The course is tough but doable. His daily shirts were the highlight of the videos :)
Here's a professor that loves his job. He makes lectures somehow feel shorter than they are and inspires students to learn more about chemistry. Truly a joy to learn from.

such an amazing professor. he's incredibly nice and funny. in his lectures, he has 'show and tell sessions where he'll show cool minerals/ antique items he has. his lectures are long (around 2 hours) but they're super interesting and really well explained. to do well in his class, do the problems in the textbook.

Took extreme advantage of online schooling as his lectures ranged from 1-2 hours long, 3x a week. Also midterm had little/nothing to do with concepts taught. Despite the bad I loved his shirts of the day always something new and funny that related to the lecture. Overall would recommend however students have to be on top of his work from day 1

Prof. Leznoff is very passionate about chemistry. Sometimes his lectures went over the allotted 3 x 50 minutes per week. His supplemental lab videos were very interesting to watch. I also looked forward to finding out his shirt of the day.

Love Prof. Leznoff, you can tell how passionate he is and he really is that fun, quirky teacher (he even wears different shirts each lecture that are somehow related to the topic that day) and it's easy to see how much he loves chem. course itself is really material heavy and one complaint is the quizzes, which don't give any feedback at all.

Really nice guy and genuinely loves chemistry. Quizzes are worth more than the final so make sure to take them seriously. Do the assignment questions and textbook questions to study, midterm and final are fair some tricky questions but as long as you understand the material and practice you should do well. Make sure you try to understand concepts.
Long lectures, but very engaging and informative. Quizzes were harsh and no solutions posted. Clearly passionate about what he does. Highly recommend taking a course with him if you have the chance!

Prof Leznoff is really passionate about chemistry and it makes his teaching extremely effective. The Course in general is hard and you have to put in a lot of work, but he is an amazing professor, totally recommend!

Leznoff is amazing!! His lectures are hilarious, and his enthusiasm is contagious! His tests are fair, and notes are well organized and clear. He has plenty of in class demonstrations, which are really cool to see and engaging. I would very highly recommend to take a course with him!

I liked Leznoff a bunch, I thought he was a great guy who was excited about chemistry in general. The course material is heavy and requires many hours to completely grasp. The practice midterm was nothing like the real one, beware of that. Final was easier than the midterm. Do all the homework and read everything a few times over to be successful

Hello, I was scared of chemistry coming into his class having only having got a 69% in high school ;). This lead me to be very hesitant and scared to take CHEM 121, but I built up my courage and decided to take it. AND WOW, what a professor! He has me on the edge of seat all the time, not only is he a beauty to look at but he also has some brains.

Always be sure to read the textbook after lecture. The textbook always clarifies things. Be sure to finish the LON CAPA every week, then get help on how to do the ones that you couldn't complete (assuming you didn't complete all of them). Quantum Mechanics and Thermochem require lots of pre-reading and post lecture reads. He talks fast.

He's really passionate about chemistry; you can tell. Explains stuff well. The midterm was hard for me, but if you understand everything and maybe make use of the textbook, you should be fine (I didn't do that for the midterm but I did that for the final ((which i found easier)), so there's some advice lol). Also don't fall behind.

Very passionate for sure. Explains concepts and material well enough. He goes very fast through the slides, so keep up with the material and you should be fine. The midterm was kinda tricky and not based on lon capa so beware of that.

The most passionate prof i have ever had, super devoted to his work and always has a big smile on his face. The only problem is that he goes fast, so if you fall behind your screwed. But if you pay attention in class, and i mean PAY ATTENTION, you will do great in his course. Don't slack off and you will be golden. He goes over every single thing.

Best Chemistry prof out there: applies lecture concepts to real- world examples which help me understand the ideas more in depth. Hilarious, extremely smart, and should consider aiming for a Nobel prize award!

He is so unorganized and messy. He made everyone think that the test is so easy but at the end the final was too tricky and hard and he put the questions he told us that is not going to be on a test. He didn't even curve the average as he told us he would :/

Chem 121 was a really difficult course, but Leznoff really was great. He's extremely nerdy and enthusiastic about chemistry, it's awesome. Couldn't think of a better prof for the class. Just study hard and try to keep up with all the concepts.
He is a fantastic prof. I absolutely loved going to his lectures, he was fun and interesting. Always helpful and scheduled extra office hours to go over midterms. Absolutely amazing.
I absolutely loved this class! Professor was very clear in his examples. All exams and assignments were completely fair. Very enthusiastic. I actually looked forward to attending his lectures.

Nice guy, tad of a know it all. midterm was average. final was ok. spends too much time on examples. tends to never have time. crammed in nuclear chemistry which was not necessary in the course. the last ten minutes covered a whole chapter

Great class! I actually looked forward to lectures- his demos and enthusiasm were fun.  The material is pretty hard but he makes it interesting and provides SO much extra help before the midterms and final, if you put in the time you'll do great!

Garry's so awesome! Very passionate about the material which makes the lectures more engaging. Textbook's required but I never used it to study and still did good. Definitely take a course if Garry's teaching it
Lectures have a noticeable portion of fluff (unneeded explanations) but the lecture notes are very easily complete-able just by reading the associated textbook chapters. Fair exams.

Gary was an amazing prof for Chem 121! He is very knowledgeable and helpful. His lectures were very clear and organized, which made them super easy to follow and understand. Would highly recommend taking this class with him if you get the opportunity.

Garry is an amazing professor who clearly has a lot of passion for the material in lecture, he gives very detailed explanations and always keeps lectures engaging. The exams are all multiple choice but deceptively difficult. However, if you study in advance and keep up with the homework, you will definitely succeed.

He's a really great guy and explains things well. I would take another chem class with him. I just hated how the final exam was worth 50% of our whole grade. Overall I recommend him for science classes.
Took Chem 121 with garry. Great prof. Cares about material and students. Make sure to study hard for midterm and finals

He taught CHEM121LAB this semester. The most clear and caring instructor ever. The Lab Handbook he gives you has all the answers to the post-lab questions. Just literally read it during the lab you don't even need to sweat and do it before. The TA's carry you and give free answers. 
Garry is a really nice guy I wish he taught the lecture.

took chem lab with Gary and overall it was better then i imagined. the labs were very easy except like one but they were pretty self explanatory if you read. he's a very nice lab instructor and very approachable. for labs make sure to read introductions for each lab as they give clues as what ur solving for in the lab report and do the lon capas

Garry is an engaging professor who makes chemistry more approachable. His clear lectures and willingness to help make the course manageable. Using Unstuck study alongside practice problems from the textbook helped me stay on track.
Had Garry for labs, very easygoing and answered questions really clearly. Really recommend putting all loncapa work on lab manual to prep for the lab itself. Makes doing the lab itself really fast.
Taught very clearly, lectures easy to follow.

Definitely one of the best profs I've had at SFU. CHEM 121 is a hard course but Garry made all the topics condensed and easy to learn. Super approachable in office hours. The exams were tough as can be considering they were all multiple choice (midterm and final) giving no room for error. Overall, amazing prof but the exams should've been written.
chem 121 overall is really hard but garry is good with lecturing and giving us 5 tries on loncapa. the midterm avg was 57 and the final avg was 55 and he scales

He's well organized and explains the topics clearly. You can tell he likes teaching and has a passion for chemistry. He always welcomed people coming up to him and asking questions about anything right after lecture and was quick to reply to any emails. It's a tough course so definitely need to do as many practice problems as possible.

Garry is top notch. His explanations are clear and precise and if you ask him for help he is always willing to help. He mad chemistry a lot easier to understand. If you can take a chem course with him do it.

Lectures were great, very clear and helpful. 
he was always available for help
tutorials were not mandatory.
the midterm was decent average was about 57% most part just do examples from did text book questions and practice exam
gary is a great prof and i would recommend taking chem 121 with him as he does an excellent job teaching the course.

Engaging lectures, he speaks in a way that makes you want to listen. He is clear and concise and his writing is easy to follow. He is clear about what should be known for exams. My class average was 10% higher than the previous semesters who all had a different prof. He's pretty chill, tutorials not mandatory. Would take again, 10/10

He was extremely caring to students in his lab. I struggled a lot with labs early in the semester, but he was very patient in explaining things to me, which was very kind of him to do in such a large class. I'm very happy to have him again next semester.
Best prof I have seen. Very thorough and interesting lectures. He makes everything very simple to understand and does many examples step by step.

love this prof. really easy to approach and obviously cares about his students. chem121 can be a little hard sometimes, but the professor himself is definitely a really good one. would recommend taking chem with him

If you are a first year Science student, your best bet is Garry Mund. He is genuinely a good teacher; he explains clearly and concisely. His tests aren't made to mess you up- as long as you do the LONCAPA, but more importantly the midterm/final review packages, you will be completely fine.

Not the most engaging lectures but explains the material well. Many examples done in class. I'd recommend reading ahead so you can follow along with them. Very helpful during office hours and doesn't make you feel dumb (even if you are). Tests are multiple-choice scantron so no part marks. Practice lots of questions and memorize the formulas!

Gary Mund is a fantastic prof. He explains everything clearly. Also, his lectures are well organized and timed. You can do pretty well on the midterm and final as long as you go to his lectures and complete the LON-CAPA assignments.

Dr Mund is an amazing prof at SFU! So excited to have him next semester. He's extremely helpful and gives clear examples that will come up later on tests. He also gives real-life examples that help you with understanding concepts. Make sure to attend his lectures even if they aren't mandatory, he gives helpful tips on what to study for.

Garry is actually a really good prof and you can do well in his class as long as you keep up with your studying. I would recommend getting helping from him immediately when you don't understand something and make sure you don't let lecture material just pile up; study and review the material after every lecture!
I recommend taking chem with garry if you do. Very clear lecture slides. He is helpful outside of class for office hours and really cares about his students.

Garry the legend. Lectures get boring but he loves his job! He's a gem of prof. Fair tests/quizzes. He'll stay after the lecture ends just in case students have questions. Makes first year chem easier than it is. Highly recommend!
Garry Mund is a living legend. This man CARES about the info hes teaching and the students learning it. He is so nice and understanding and is probably the best prof I had all sem
Does examples on the projector. Goes over notes in lots of details. Overall very caring.

Garry is an amazing chem prof and would highly recommend taking his class. He explains concepts clearly and tells you exactly what you need to focus on. Just reinforce your learning with a few textbook questions and you're golden.
Gary was the best prof Ive ever had. Definitely makes everything very clear
Best prof I've had in sfu. His exams are quite weighted, but if you attend all the lectures and take notes you'll do fine.

Garry Mund was a phenomenal professor! Made it clear he was willing to work with the students and created a safe, enjoyable environment for anyone who was willing to put in the effort. Would easily take the course again, best professor I've ever had.

Such an amazing prof. He assigns LONCAPA homework every week. Quizzes are exactly like the homework. However, I used my textbook questions to study for the midterm and final, not the homework. These were the only times I used my textbook, and he recommends you don't go and buy a brand new $200 newest edition text. Buy an older used version
Hands down best prof at SFU. Very clear on whats expected. I would recommend him to EVERY first year.
He really is worth it

Good professor ! He explains so well and so approachable. As class could be boring at times, it is a MUST to attend!! Midterm was fairly easy, as long as you understand the class material and do a few textbook questions; you're good to go! Overall enjoyed that class a lot !
Super easygoing. Nice guy. Really helpful, especially during labs. Makes things as simple as possible.

Best chemistry professor at SFU for sure. If your a first year definitely take it with Mund. He makes difficult topics simple and clear. He always tells you what to expect for the exams. Chemistry is usually a tough course but having Mund as your professor makes the course tolerable for those not good at chem.

Most clear and concise professor for Chemistry.  He definitely teaches you what you need to know and in a way that is understandable for everyone.  If you need help, he is there for you.  Best professor ever, hands down.
Garry is my favourite Sfu professor
amazing amazing amazing prof.. really knows how to teach and very helpful if you go to office hours. His exams are hard though but you are taught well

Dr. Mund is the best prof I have ever had. he replies to all the emails no matter what issue it is about. Always willing to help in any situation. I really enjoyed his classes and it has come to a point where its almost like 'I want Garry for chem or none'. do whatever it takes to get into his class, cos I did it and you will not regret.
Dr. Mund is super helpful, and very approachable.

Really great prof! Extremely helpful lectures, very approachable in labs, and good, fair exams. Even if his lectures tend to be a bit dry due to material, his slideshows are all you need--barely ever had to use the textbook. Definitely looking forward to another semester with him!

He is by far my favourite prof! He is ALWAYS available for help and will make sure you get the material.His lectures are very interesting and prepare you for the exams; with his notes, you don't even need to look at the textbook! His labs are super easy. The report sheets are a piece of cake. P.S. love it when he gets mad! lol

No one is exaggerating when they say how nice and helpful he is. He is great. Best professor I have had in my 3 yrs. However his exams are really tricky but luckily scaling usually works in your favor
He is a nice guy who is always willing to help. His exams can be tricky, so you definitely need to study everything properly. I would recommend him!

Best prof I've had at SFU so far in 3 years. I had him for Chem 121, 122, and 126, and I got an A in every class. He scales BEAUTIFULLY and is so helpful. He's not intimidating at all so PLEASE take any class with him. His exams aren't easy, but chem isn't an easy subject, so overall he was fair.

He is the best intro Chemistry prof you could ask for. If you make any effort whatsoever to keep up, attending class is actually quite enjoyable. He is super nice, relaxed, and just overall a fantastic teacher. Do whatever you can to have him as your prof.
extremely clear and concise. Really nice and helpful.  Everything a chem prof should be.

This prof was the best one by far...knows how to explain the concepts very well and is extremely patient if students do not understand the material. midterm was hard but the final was really easy. Make sure you look at the textbook questions and Loncapa...if you do that you should ace the final!  It also helps that he's easy on the eyes;)

good prof.good explanation, and clear notes.very patient prof, when you ask him assignment,he will teach you how to solve Qs, very helpful prof.Most students go to his office to ask him Qs rather than to ask the TA. TA is not helpful. Midterm exam is hard, but the final is fair.Read the text book examples are good preparing for the exams.
THIS DUDE ROCKS!EVERY LECTURE WAS CLEAR AND CONCISE AND HE HAS THE ABILITY TO TURN A DIFFICULT CONCEPT INTO A VERY SIMPLE IDEA. GREAT PROF. WOULD RECOMMEND ANYONE TO TAKE HIS CLASS.
This guy is a straight up G.
Clear notes.                Clear explantions. He is very helpful and so~~ nice.  I strongly recommend you to take this course with him.

A really really good prof. Very helpful and really good at explaining things. He also spells out everything you NEED and doesn't go in depth about material you're not tested on. Really approachable. Definitely recommended.
good

Great Prof ! The best class notes I've ever seen at SFU. Extremely approachable, incredeable helpful... what else could you want in a prof!  His lectures are interesting (not boring), his exams are very fair (most chem profs are unreasonably difficult). Take Chem 121 with G. Mund, you won't regret it ! You'll be lucky to take his class!
Awesome teacher
love paul li, take any chem course with him and you will succeed. he will take the time to teach you content if you go to his review sessions before an exam. don't stress to impress.

Great Guy, yes I know some students have mixed feelings, however I would like to emphasize how caring he was during office hours and his exams were not bad if you just went to lectures, east peasy lemon squeeze - jasper wong
Take it right now!

Terrible lectures as he will drone on and on and they are exceptionally boring to listen to.
However, his tests are fair and it is possible to do well on all of them. Homework and tutorials make up a good portion of the marks and most of the learning can be done through them instead of going to lecture.

Professor Li was really helpful during lectures as he went through examples that would end up showing up on exams, make sure to attend all his lectures. He was always super responsive in his emails and his exams were fair game. The class average for his chem class was higher than any other chem class, expect weekly  assignments to take a few hours.

Attendance rates were at about 30% for lectures. He refuses to buy a tablet and spends his time trying to draw with a mouse. He is fairly knowledgeable about chemistry, but I felt most of his teaching was him trying to impress us with his knowledge of "special relativity". His English isn't good. However the assignments/exams weren't difficult.

Paul Li's lectures are not helpful at all. The worse is that he goes through theory and history which isn't needed. It would be better to have lectures mainly based on questions which can further prepare for the exam. I would recommend to use the textbook and LON-CAPA instead of his lectures. Overall, maybe do it with another prof.

Paul Li's lectures were by far the worst lectures I have ever attended. If you want to make good use of your time, skip lectures and read textbook. His good points are that he follows the given textbook VERY closely and that the mid term and final pulls questions from textbook, lon capa and tutorials, so his examinations were actually overall fair.

Paul is a funny guy who is very knowledgeable about random things. However, I remember more random useless information from Paul then what is actually relevant to class. I don't recommend attending lectures unless you want to have a good laugh. Paul desparately needs an iPad as he write solutions to questions with his PC mouse.Prepare to self study

Lectures are not worth going to, plenty of mistakes in his solutions, focuses too much on some sections while skimming others. Only redeeming factor was how fair the midterm was. Final is much harder as alot of content post midterm is completely separate, and the given formula sheet is absolutely useless. Try to avoid.

Paul can't explain concepts clearly and concisely in an engaging way. Memorize your formulas because the ones he gives you on the formula sheet really aren't going to help you on the final... There's no written questions on exams; so say goodbye to part marks. Practice material he gave didn't really help much either for the final.

He needs to invest in a pen so he can stop trying to draw with his mouse on his computer. He takes too long to get to certain concepts and when he explains theories we need to know, he breezes over them. At this point the textbook can teach you better.
Midterm was fair, questions were very similar to assignments & practice questions. Paul is a nice guy but his lectures were not worth attending.

Dr storr is the best!! Made himself super available for help, and was very helpful. I also took this course with Leznoff and warren and storr is a thousand times better. Only good things to say about him!

He's a nice teacher. However, what he teaches is not on the exam at all. I did the entire textbook and homework and barely passed. Class avg was below 50, which was considered high. Chem 121 is a hard class with the lab especially. I'd recommend taking chem 120, and 126 separately. Tim a nice prof but this course is not it.
He is very organized and clear in lectures, his exams are difficult but they are not impossible pay close attention to practice midterms and finals and do as many as you can find.

DO NOT BUY TEXTBOOK I bought it but never used it once. Maybe you want one but at least wait and see if your actually going to use it. Great prof. very engaging lectures and very fair tests. Homework is very challenging, find people to work on it with as it is very difficult to do alone. Labs are stressful, read ahead of time.
He was a good lecturer, the course itself is just A LOT so it was hard to absorb everything in class. Do the homework and use reading break to study for the midterm and you'll be okay. (probably)

The prof does not post the completed slides which makes hard if you don't write something or miss the lecture. He only reads off from the slides which makes it hard to understand. He will have only one or two practice questions in the slides for which he won't post the answer key afterwards. Avoid taking class with him.

between the weekly homework and studying for the labs, this class will keep you busy. tim does not teach enough to understand the hw. the lectures are usually theory based, so it doesn't help with the homework. if you ask him questions during class he'll answer them too quick to actually be able to understand. not a very good prof but he's nice ig

Goes too fast during lectures, covers 120+ slides in class (50 minute class), so it's hard to keep up. Lectures don't help with the homework, but he has regular office hours if you need help. You can see his passion for chem. He genuinely loves it. He doesn't go in depth about much though. Find better lectures online so you understand the content..
Chem 121 is an extremely tough course but tim made it easy! I would recommend taking this class with him

I think it's ridiculous he won't post his finished lecture notes after each class bc it "lowers attendance". Honestly this whole format is outdated to a time when electronics weren't widely used. All notes and lecture materials should be made available on canvas. He's incredibly old school and it hurts students ability to learn.
Tim is pretty chill and an amazing prof. Recommend taking his class
Tim is good professor. He's very accessible during office hours and offers great help for concepts you don't understand. Lectures are heavy however, he will cover 40+ slides in one 50 minute lecture.

Great Guy and super helpful. Chem 121 is tough and pretty boring and he really wants to transform it into something unique. He's super passionate and super friendly. He's the type of prof you would wave hello to in the hall. Visit his office hours and your grade will look great. I realise how good he was now that I dont have him any more.
Notes can be confusing, you have to be really focused and follow. The textbook was my saving grace in this course.  Otherwise, the prof is really nice and is ready to help.
Exams were fair, just have to put in the work.  Lectures were very organized and he always welcomed questions

Tim just talks and doesnt really teach anything. He covers a lot of material very quickly and leaves students to do a lot of catch-up and learning on their own. He provides practice exams and review sessions, but his exams are significantly harder than the review questions. Be prepared to do lots of work on your own and still be lost and confused.

He's a very nice and organized professor, however he just reads off a PowerPoint making it uninteresting, thus hard to pay attention. You really have to do extra work, because just going to the lectures isn't enough. I learned more in tutorials than I did in lecture.
He's an amazing prof, very good at explaining the content and tells you exactly what you need to know for the exams. Also holds alot of review sessions and office hours for extra help.

Professor Storr was ok, he's friendly and does cool experiments in lectures sometimes. However, the lectures are mostly theory based and fall off short once it comes to actually doing the loncapa assignments/mid-term. The course itself is fairly difficult and moves at a fast pace.
lectures are dry and the course is hard plus the content is heavy for a first year chem course

He is a good teacher, but the midterm was very difficult. I studied one week in advance for the midterm and did awful, I feel as the notes did not cover what was in the midterm, so the textbook examples are mandatory. His lectures have cool experiments, but it's hard to pay attention as so much material is covered in a short amount of time.

Does a good job of explaining the main concepts, and helps with some of the harder LON CAPA questions. Fair marker and manages to keep the class fun from time to time without falling behind or rushing.

Cool prof, does a lot of small experiments in class to demonstrate chemical principles, which are always cool.  Assigns a lot of loncapa questions, but he goes through some of the tough ones in the lecture. Very good prof.

Four of my friends had their laptops open in her class and were minding their own business. All of a sudden, the prof stops, walks over, and openly says: "You four, get out...". They were not disrupting class in any way.
i just wrote the final yesterday and it wasn't too bad. Her midterms are not hard. As a person, she's nice. As a teacher, she's not very clear.
her thick accent makes it hard to understand her! and her lectures aren't very productive... haha but you'll think she's kinda funny if you don't take her rude comments so seriously.
her multiple choice midterms are easy..kinda difficult to understand b/c of accent.. as a person, she's  nice..

She's actually not too bad. If you just accept her attitude, you'll see that she's a genuinely nice person! I promise.           But like every other instructor, she wants her students to study hard. BTW, so far her exams have been fairly easy(midterms I and II)!
one of the worst profs. i've ever had. no matter what your question is, she will always give u the "r u stupid?" look. doesn't show any respect to students.
Be prepared to struggle. Lectures focus on theory and ochem rather than the course material. Exams don't align with what's taught. Unstuck study and the textbook may be helpful for study prep.

Avoid. Does not share whats going to be on exams, not even the amount of questions. Talks about random things mid lecture and changes curriculum mid semester. Prof focused on chem 122 topics and ochem topics. Does not help in labs at all pray you get a good ta. Yells at tutorials. Not a very nice prof at all

I don't know where to begin, the lectures focused more on theory and a lot of ochem stuff and on the final there was a lot of calculations, so make sure you pay attention to calculations in class and diagrams as well. Didn't want to assign textbook chapter as he claimed it's too much work for him.

His first time teaching this class and he treated us like 4th years, in a first year class. exam was nothing like what he's been teaching. if anything it was more of a chem 1222 and 281 exam. Dodge just wait to do your next class. He says he doesn't believe in calculation that gives us an exam based on calculation of organic structures we've never

oh my days.... how this man has left a few strands of hair on my head

i feel like ripping my hair follicles out every time i see him. 
he is not approachable, exam was nothing compared to what he said and was 80% calculation based when he said i dont rlly go over calculations

not to mention he hovers over you in lab in a creepy way.

He will throw random pop quizzes and does not communicate when there are quizzes and assignments he just does them whenever he wants. Lectures are not recorded and when you go to lectures it is just him reading slides full of text and no explanation. If you have another option at a different campus switch courses for your own good.
Really confusing teaching, especially for an intro chemistry course.

I don't even know where to begin describing this professor, he confused me so much during chem and I honestly didn't learn anything from him I just studied myself and taught myself this entire course.
Absolute disaster of a prof, extremely condescending and rude to students. He makes you feel stupid for asking any kind of questions. Avoid him if possible!!!
Terrible, disaster. To be honest I don't know how this man got his job.

His lectures are very calming. However, they are not necessarily the most helpful. You will have to read through hundreds of slides of lecture notes and pull multiple all nighters just to pass the exam. Even then there is no guarantee. RIP

this prof has to be one of the worst. he does not go over examples and expects students to do loncapa assignment questions that are way harder. wants you to ask questions, but he never really explains them properly or he says "haa idk". not going to lectures was same as going

Very difficult to do well in this class. Has not taught 1st year and it shows in his style. Encourages questions but rarely (if at all) answers them clearly. No practice exams or questions. Online assignments and tests are 100x more difficult than the (very few) questions done in lecture. If possible do not take this class with Uwe.

Terrible. Cant explain the course material, extremely hard mid term(due to lack of practice problems), lectures are boring and not helpful at all, not worth going. I taught myself this entire course. He encourages questions, but doesnt know how to answer them.

It is his first time teaching a Chem121 course. He does not have any study material so you would not know what to expect on the Midterm(which very few people did well on btw). Lectures are very dry and boring he does not go over how to do any practice problems in class. Online assignments never relate to lecture material. AVOID CHEM 121 with UWE!!!
Hes just terrible. Friendly, but terrible.
No Comments
bad attitude towards students, openly states he is only here to do research, made me hate chem with a vengeance.  multiple choice exams have a pattern though...
Hates first year kinds and openly acknowledges it.  The only thing i remember from his class are his ugly mug and that he works @ TRIUMF.
D'Auria's tough, but its necessary to filter out the students who aren't willing to work hard in a first year class to avoid large class sizes in later courses.
all 1st year students should AVIOD him at all costs!
It's a hard course....and he's a hard prof with little regard fro the students
Do end of chapter questions to study for exams. Her lectures are good and I think some curving happened at the end.

Lecture slides were overly long and not useful. While she seemed nice and caring, teaching could have been better. Lab reports were graded very strictly with little time to finish. No clear grade outline until the end of semester, and exams were overly long and theory based despite practical focus in class and on assignments. Would not recommend.

Exams are very difficult. Many questions were ones that I weren't familiar with, despite doing hundreds of textbook questions, every lecture question and practice exams. She's an alright teacher with a bubbling personality but this does not outweigh the difficulty at all.

As a person, she's great. She's funny and you can tell she cares, but she isn't the most amazing professor. She does a poor job of explaining certain concepts. She's very smart and I think maybe it's hard for her dumb it down to the "first-year--level". Tests and exams were also often unreasonable and unrealistic, with a lot of trick questions.

She graded me and my friends lab, she guided us through it, we gave back the reports and she gave it back to us the same day, Received a 1 out of 30. Both of us. Makes zero sense for her to do this. Extremely tough grader because what the flip.

She comes off as warm and friendly in lectures, but she is by far the most incompetent educator I have ever had. She makes lots of mistakes in lectures, slides are extremely long, getting grades back is more complicated than it needs to be, tutorials are a mess (and sometimes AI generated). If you're a more independent student you'll be fine.

Please do not take her if you have other options. For chem 121 I taught myself basically everything. Her slides were taken right off the internet, and they weren't informative enough. Her quizzes were poorly formatted and she gave us little details about them.

Overall Dr. Goyan was a decent professor. She has a ton of resources for extra help and has pre-recorded all of her lectures which is helpful. The lectures can be confusing so it helped a lot that I could go rewatch topics that I didn't understand. She seems to really care about students and made herself available for help often.

as a first year, goyan was tough. chem 122 is NOT CURVED iirc. 830 lecs did not help at all but not her fault. she records ALL her lectures, provides textbook questions + extra practice problems (textbook is free or easily accessible). lecture material was confusing no matter how much i studied and quizzes were fair but also confusing at times?

Dr. Goyan tends to go off topic a lot during her lectures, typically with stories about her life and past experiences. Her lectures are not the worst, some chapters contain lectures that are 100 - 150 slides long so it tends to become tedious when reviewing them. However, all her lectures are recorded so thats a plus. Overall pre mid prof.

Dr.Goyan is an extremely kind and caring professor. She does stray from the lecture material during lectures, talking about her own experiences and examples, but not to the extent I feel people portray on here. She was always happy to chat about anything, even non-chemistry topics. She is a great prof as long and will do her best to see you do well

Dr Goyan is a pretty good teacher. She's available to help often, teaches the material in a pretty easy-to-understand way (both in lectures and office hours), puts her full slides up for people to read, AND she usually gives a free bonus mark on tests.

Dr. Goyan is very unorganized, has tech issues, and her work was all over the place, making it hard to follow along. She also goes off on tangents in the middle of lectures and so we're unable to finish the notes. 

However, she is accessible outside of class and is there to help. It's true that she tends to get 'creative' on her tests though...
Horrible, avoid her. Some lectures had 300 slides and she never talked about any homework questions. Always talked about random stuff

Not a great lecturer and cannot convey concepts to make it easy to comprehend. Often talks about her personal issues during lectures which wastes time that we could've spent on understanding her 110+ slides which is filled with info we don't need to know majority of the time. Midterm was fair but the final was horrible/too long to complete

Overall Goyan is a solid Prof, her tests take up most of the % in the class. Final - 45% Midterm-25% 

Lectures can be boring sometimes and her lecture slides aren't the best. Hard to understand her writing and writes extremely fast. She is extremely accessible after class and will help you if you go to her.

Had to read the textbook and watch youtube videos to actually understand the material better because the lectures weren't enough. Tests were alright, but she was disorganized. We also never got to see most of our lab reports and only got our lab grades back at the end of the semester, so we never knew how we were doing/how to improve.

She is a lovely person buts he was just a big mess. She didn't number the midterm question correctly so we had to do that and she wasn't even there. final was chaos and it was all poorly managed. we started late and did not get extra time after and another class came in while we were still doing our exams. So many questions for less 3 hours. AVOID

Dr. goyan is definitely a nice person and very approachable. She will help you if needed in her office hours. The downside is that her lecture notes barely help you understand the material (you have to learn on your own if you want do well) and she does not provide any feedback on quizzes or exams, so you will never know what you need to work on.

Poor teaching skills. Midterm and final exam average was 50% aprox. EXTREMELY long and hard exams. 3hr long exams and still not enough time to complete the exam. Absolutely no feedback in her class. I understand this is a online course but still no excuse to not provide feedback. Apparently the department is not a big fan of her teaching either.
Overall not a bad prof. Has good lectures and is willing to help outside of class. Somewhat disorganized, understand the concepts REALLY well and you will be good.

Dr. Goyan is approachable and adaptable. She has a sense of humour that grew on me throughout the semester and made chem lectures more bearable. There is a lot of homework in this course, but if you are willing to get help (OH) it is not unmanageable. Bottom line, Dr. Goyan wants everyone to succeed, even if she is a little disorganized at times.

I honestly have no clue why these ratings are so low. She is the most approachable prof I have ever had and understands students very well. Yes, she has trouble with technology sometimes, but don't we all? She explains concepts VERY well and she's sincerely a good person. Lots of homework but it's manageable. Textbook required to access homework :)

Dr. Goyan's lectures were good. Considering the online format she kept at a good pace. There was a lot of homework in this course. There was online homework on Lon Capa and Sapling, which adds up. The midterm exam was alright, some hard questions. Need to manage your time well and you'll be okay.

Hands down one of the most disorganized proffs, I have ever taken. Not only disorganized but also unfair, her exam covers nothing from assignments (which makes this course feel like 5 cred instead of 4) and she grades you like you are supposed to know concept she barely covered or tricky questions that look nothing like material covered.

Super passionate about chemistry however she was extremely disorganized and  spent most of the lecture (30-40min) talking about her family. Her exams were fair. I honestly stopped attending lectures after the midterm and still ended up with a B+ for the course. Just make sure you focus on the theories surrounding the main concepts.

I cannot recommend a prof more than Gary, he explains concepts really well. Midterm was fair if studied enough, final was easier. He cares about his students and wants people to genuinely learn. He never over complicated things and his test were a reflection of material taught. I wish he taught every class because I would be in every single one.

Had Dr. Mund for the lab portion of CHEM 121. Love him with everything. He was extremely helpful and kind and friendly to engage with during labs. Even when he technically wasn't allowed to answer questions during lab writeups, he would give subtle hints because he wanted us to succeed. Would love to do labs with him as the prof again!

he's a great prof one of my favourites definetely recommend taking chemistry with him he's very good at teaching. His first midterm was hard but the second one was easy and the final was fair you just have to practice a lot of questions from the book and you are guranteed a B

very helpful, i had two midterms worth 20% each and a 40% final, his class is the review of the chapter from the book, BUT TO GET GOOD MARKS U MUST STUDY THE BOOK THOROUGHLY b.c his exams are very similar to the book questions.

good and helpful prof. but the midterm is hard, the final is fair. read the textbook examples.

A great prof for first year chemistry, light hearted, funny, and incredibly nice. The prof is one of the best that i have had so far, he is good at explaining and makes chem fun (never thought i would say that). the material gets harder by the week and there is a LON CAPA due every Saturday and there is a lab which is mandatory which also has another LON CAPA that is need to be completed before each lab.
Would never take it with him. Funny guy but you learn nothing. Avoid at all costs!! Take Chem 121 with Mund instead! Now that guy knows how to teach!

attend tutorials and do as many questions from practice exam and textbook as you can. forget the lecture if you want, he talks about other stuff and does useless experiments anyway, 33 MCQ midterm in 2 hours

Holdcroft is one of the funniest profs I've had. He is very thorough when he does examples, although sometimes he goes a bit fast. A lot of the course is repeating chem 11 stuff. He does a lot of fun experiments and gives good hints for exams.

makes you memorize lots of formula. does too many experiments at the expense of explanations of concepts and examples, midterm seemed mostly fair. good prof with concise notes. almost every lecture he does an interesting experiment. he's engaging in class and you can really tell that he loves what he does. however, the midterm was a tad bit tricky
